class.name: Fighter
class.desc: You are proficient with many weapons
class.hitpoint_per_level: d10 + CON modifier or 6 + CON modifier

features.name: Fighting style
features.desc: You gain a fighting style feat. for each level you gain you can change this feat.

features.name: Second wind
features.desc: Using a bonus action, you can expend one use of second wind to regain 1d10 + fighter level of health. You regain a single use after a short rest and all uses after a long rest. See the table to see how many times you can use it for your level.

features.name: Weapon mastery
features.desc: You gain mastery in a number of simple and martial weapons of your choice. See the table to see how many you are allowed to have per level.

features.name: Action surge
features.desc: On your turn (once per short or long rest, from level 17 and higher twice.) you can take an extra action thats not a magic action.

features.name: tactical mind
features.desc: When you fail an ability check you can expend one second wind use to roll a d10 and add that value to your previously rolled value.

features.name: Fighter
features.desc: Gain a subclass for your fighter character

features.name: Ability score improvement
features.desc: Improve your Ability Score or choose another feat you qualify for

features.name: Extra attack
features.desc: Whenever doing an attack action, you can take another attack action on the same turn.

features.name: tactical shift
features.desc: When using second wind with a bonus action, you can move half your speed without causing opportunity attacks.

features.name: Tactical master

features.name: Studied attacks
features.desc: When you miss an attack on an enemy, you have advantage the next time you attack it.

features.name: Epic boon

subclasses.name: Battle master
subclasses.desc: You have studied the art of battle

features.name: Combat superiority
features.desc: You learn maneuvres fueled by superiority dice

feature_data.name: Maneuvres
feature_data.desc: You know 3 maneuvres from the maneuvres table. you learn additional maneuvres at level 7, 10 and 15

feature_data.name: Superiority dice
feature_data.desc: You have 4 superiority dice (d8) which are expended when used. You regain all expended dice after a short or long rest. You gain a die on level 7 and 15

feature_data.name: Saving throws
feature_data.desc: if a maneuvre requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + STR/DEX + proficiency bonus

features.name: Student of war
features.desc: You gain proficiency in one type of artisan's tools and a skill of your choice available to lvl 1 fighters.

features.name: Maneuvre options
features.desc: You can choose from this big list (seriously why is this so big this is so painful to develop)

feature_data.name: Ambush
feature_data.desc: When making a DEX(stealth) or initiative roll you can expend a superiority die and add the value to the roll unless you're incapacitated

feature_data.name: Bait and switch
feature_data.desc: when within 5ft of a creature you can expend a superiority die and swap places with the creature (if the creature isnt incapacitated, is willing to move and you move at least 5ft). You or the other creature get the rolled value as bonus on AC as well until next turn.

feature_data.name: Commander's strike
feature_data.desc: When doing an attack, you can replace one of your attacks and let another willing creature do a reaction and make an attack instead. expend a superiority die and add it to the damage of the attack.

feature_data.name: Commanding precense
feature_data.desc: When making a CHA (intimidation, performance or persuasion) check you can add the value of one of your superiority die to this check

feature_data.name: Disarming attack
feature_data.desc: When doing an attack you can attempt disarming the target using your superiority die. add the rolled value to the damage of the attack. The target must succeed on a STR saving throw or drop one of the items its holding.

feature_data.name: Distracting strike
feature_data.desc: When doing an attack on a creature and hitting it, you can expend a superiority die, add the rolled value to the damage and distract the target. The next attacker attacking the target will have advantage.

feature_data.name: Evasive footwork
feature_data.desc: Using a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die to take the disengage action. The rolled value will be added to your AC on the next turn.

feature_data.name: Feinting attack
feature_data.desc: Using a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die to feint, choosing on creature within 5ft of yourself. You have advantage on that creature on your next turn. when it hits add the rolled value to the damage

feature_data.name: Goarding attack
feature_data.desc: When doing an attack on a creature and hitting it, use one of your superiority die to try to goad the target into attacking you. Of course you can add the rolled value to the damage. The target must make a WIS saving throw. on a fail it'll have disadvantage on all party members except for you.

feature_data.name: Lunging attack
feature_data.desc: Using a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die to take the dash action. if you move 5ft in a straight line before hitting a melee attack on this turn, you can add the rolled value to the damage.

feature_data.name: Maneuvreing attack
feature_data.desc: When doing an attack on a creature and hitting it, use one of your superiority die to maneuvre one of your allies who is willing to move and can see/hear you to move half its speed as areaction. you can add your rolled value to the damage.

feature_data.name: Parry
feature_data.desc: When another creature damages you with a melee attack roll, you can take a reaction and expend a superiority die to reduce the damage. the reduced damage equals the rolled value + DEX or STR modifier.

feature_data.name: Precision attack
feature_data.desc: When you miss an attack on an enemy, you can use one superiority die and add it to the roll.

feature_data.name: Pushing attack
feature_data.desc: When doing an attack on a creature and hitting it, use one of your superiority die to attempt pushing the target. if the target is large or smaller it must do a STR saving throw or it'll be pushed back 15ft. You can add the rolled value to the damage.

feature_data.name: Rally
feature_data.desc: Using a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die to give an ally within 30ft of you that can see/hear you an amount of temporary HP equal to the roll value + half your fighter level (rounded down, level 3 would be 1 added to the roll.)

feature_data.name: Riposte
feature_data.desc: When another creature misses you with a melee attack roll, you can use a reaction to expend a superiority die to make an attack to that creature. when you hit you can add the rolled value to the damage.

feature_data.name: Sweeping attack
feature_data.desc: When doing an attack on a creature and hitting it, use one of your superiority die to damage another creature of choice within 5ft to deal the rolled value (of your superiority die) of damage

feature_data.name: Tactical assessment
feature_data.desc: When making an INT (history, investigation) or WIS (insight) check you can expend one superiority die and add the rolled value to your check roll.

feature_data.name: Trip attack
feature_data.desc: When doing an attack on a creature and hitting it, use one of your superiority die to make the creature (Large or smaller) prone on a failed STR check. add the rolled value to the damage.

features.name: Know your enemy
features.desc: Using a bonus action, you can learn strengths and weaknesses of a creature you can see within 30ft. use once per long rest (or regain the use with a superiority die)

features.name: Improved combat superiority
features.desc: The superiority die becomes a d10 instead of a d8

features.name: Relentless
features.desc: Once per turn when maneuvreing you can roll a d8 instead of a superiority die, so you dont have to expend a superiority die

features.name: Ultimate combat superiority
features.desc: The superiority die becomes a d12 instead of a d10

subclasses.name: Champion
subclasses.desc: You focus on developing your martial arts for victory

features.name: Improved critical
features.desc: Attack rolls made with weapons or an unarmed strike score a critical hit on a 19 or 20 on a d20

features.name: Remarkable athlete
features.desc: You have advantage on STR (athletics) checks and can move half your speed away without causing opportunity attacks when you score a critical

features.name: Additional fighting style
features.desc: You gain a fighting style feat.

features.name: Heroic warrior
features.desc: You can give yourself heroic inspiration whenever you start your turn without it

features.name: Superior critical
features.desc: Attack rolls made with weapons or an unarmed strike score a critical hit on a 18 to 20 on a d20

features.name: Survivor
features.desc: You gain these benefits:

feature_data.name: Defy death
feature_data.desc: You have advantage on death saving throws, and when you roll a 18-20 you get the advantage of rolling a 20

feature_data.name: Heroic rally
feature_data.desc: On the start of your turn, you gain HP equal to 5 + CON modifier if you have damage and have at least 1 hit point

subclasses.name: Eldritch knight
subclasses.desc: You learned magic to help you in combat

features.name: Spellcasting
features.desc: You know how to cast spells. You can use spells on the wizard spell list

feature_data.name: Cantrips
feature_data.desc: You learn 2 cantrips of your choice from the wizard spell list. This choice can be changed whenever you gain a character level.

feature_data.name: Spell slots
feature_data.desc: You have limited amounts of spell slots. See your wizard's level class features to see how many you're allowed to have

feature_data.name: Prepared spells
feature_data.desc: You prepare a list of spells available to you. See your fighter's level class features to see how many you're allowed to have prepared

feature_data.name: Replacing prepared spells
feature_data.desc: When your character level increases, you can change one spell of your spell list with another one with the correct spell slot

feature_data.name: Spellcasting ability
feature_data.desc: You use INT as your spellcasting ability

feature_data.name: Spellcasting focus
feature_data.desc: you can use arcane focus for spellcasting

features.name: War bond
features.desc: you can create a magical bond between you and your weapon. You can do this for 1 hour and once per short rest. You cant be disarmed of this weapon during that period.

features.name: War magic
features.desc: Whan doing an attack action, you can replace one of the attacks with a casting of a wizard cantrip.

features.name: Eldritch strike
features.desc: When doing an attack on a creature and hitting it, the creature will have disadvantage on saving throws against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

features.name: Arcane charge
features.desc: When using Action surge you can teleport up to 30ft to a spot you can see

features.name: Improved war magic
features.desc: Whan doing an attack action, you can replace two of the attacks with a casting of one wizard lvl 1 spell or level 2 spell.

subclasses.name: Psi warrior
subclasses.desc: you use the power of your mind during combat

features.name: Psionic power
features.desc: You have psionic energy within yourself represented by Psionic energy dice (Energy die) which fuels powers of this subclass. You regain all expended uses after a long rest and a single expended use after a short rest. See your psionic dice per level here:

features.name: Psionic power features
features.desc: the features of psionic power

feature_data.name: Protective field
feature_data.desc: When another creature in the range of 30ft takes damage, you can expend one energy die and reduce that damage by the rolled value + your INT modifier

feature_data.name: psionic strike
feature_data.desc: Once per turn after hitting a creature within 30ft of you and damaging it with a weapon, you can expend an energy die and add your rolled value + INT modifier to that

feature_data.name: Telekinetic movement
feature_data.desc: Using a magic action, you can choose a target within 30ft of you, like a Large or smaller loose object or a willing creature (excluding yourself) and move it in a range of 30ft. if the object is tiny you can also guide it towards your hand. Use once per short or long rest or expend an energy die to regain the use.

features.name: Telekinetic adept
features.desc: You know new ways to use your telekinetic powers:

feature_data.name: Psi-powered leap
feature_data.desc: Using a bonus action, you get a flight speed equal twice your speed until the end of your turn. Use once per short or long rest or expend one energy die to regain the use.

feature_data.name: Telekinetic thrust
feature_data.desc: When dealing damage with psionic strike, the target has to make a STR saving throw (DC8 + INT modifier + Proficiency bonus). The target will be transported 10ft horizontally or be proned on a fail.

features.name: Guarded mind
features.desc: You are resistant to psychic damage and can expend an energy die to remove the charmed or frightened condition at the start of your turn.

features.name: Bulwark of force
features.desc: Using a bonus action you can protect you and others with a shield. you can choose creatures (up to an amount equal to INT modifier) within 30ft of you, including yourself to have half cover for a minute. use once per long rest or by expending an energy die

features.name: Telekinetic master
features.desc: You always know the telekinesis spell and can cast it without spell slots. your spellcasting ability is INT. While maintaining concentration for the spell you can attack once using a bonus action. Use once per long rest or expend an energy die to regain a use.
